cyclone.name: BONNIE
cyclone.current_location: about 120 mi (195 km) SE of Beaufort, South Carolina

motion.direction: Stationary (expected to begin drifting NNW overnight)

cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move north-northwest, reach the central South Carolina coast on Sunday, then meander slowly northeast along the Carolina coastline through mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central South Carolina coast near/just north of Charleston

weather_observation.watch_coast: None for the Florida Gulf Coast; no tropical storm or hurricane watches issued west of the Atlantic coastline
weather_observation.warning_coast: Savannah River, GA to Little River Inlet, SC under Tropical Storm Warning
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coastal Georgia, South Carolina, and eventually southeastern North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Only occasional breezy conditions expected; tropical-storm-force winds not anticipated at the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the Tampa Bay area
weather_observation.rainfall: Light outer-band showers possible; totals generally under 2 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased rip-current risk along Gulf beaches
